content: this cardigan is worked from the top down beginning with the back panel which is shaped with german short row at the shoulders once the underarm depth is reached the back stitches are placed on hold the front shoulders are then picked up one at a time and shaped with increases to form the neckline and worked to match the length of the back panel the front panels are joined to the back and the body is knit flat the sleeves will then be picked up and knit top down in the round the button-band is added next by picking up stitches on each front panel followed by the collar decorative fish are added last using the duplicate stitch technique full youtube tutorial available https //youtu be/xxfcsd4dqz4 sizes 3mo 6mo 12mo 2yrs 3yrs gauge 22 stitches by 29 rounds over 4x4 inches / 10 x10 cm in stockinette stitch finished measurements chest circumference 24 75 25 5 26 25 27 75 29 inches / 63 65 66 5 70 5 73 5 cm yoke depth 5 5 5 6 6 5 7 inches / 12 5 14 15 16 5 18 cm body length 6 5 7 7 5 8 5 9 inches / 16 5 18 19 21 5 23 cm sleeve length 7 7 5 8 8 5 9 5 inches / 18 19 20 5 21 5 24 cm yarn 2 2 2 2 3 skeins of berroco vintage dk 52% acrylic 40% wool 8% nylon or 150 150 200 200 250 grams / 390 430 540 575 680 yards / 356 393 494 526 622 meters of dk weight yarn that measures approximately 290 yards / 266 meters per 100 grams for the fish you will need approximately 5 grams / 15 yards / 13 meters of scrap yarn needles us 7 4 5 mm 32 inch / 80 cm circular needles us 4 3 5 mm 32 inch / 80 cm circular needles notions tapestry needle 2 stitch holders or scrap yarn 6 6 6 7 7 buttons approximately 5/8 inch / 15mm in diameter email kaaburaknits@gmail com for pattern support
